alert.note: Alert for Catano (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 01 at 9:09AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM AST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Catano and Toa Baja. * WHEN...Until 945 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
